messageBody:
Hi Rainsberger,

> How do you know whether your method works? What
> would you do to verify
> for yourself that the method reads the data
> correctly? Explain that in
> words and we can convert it to code.

The method which i want to test returns the file as a
String object. Now, i was thinking if i have to test
what is read from the file, in the testcase i would
again be reading from the file. The contents read from
the file would be converted to String which would be
compared to the value returned by the method for which
the testcase is being written (sorry no TFD). But i
found it to be weird idea, so i asked the question :-)


I think, it would be correct ( as George suggested )
to return the InputStream from the method. I can
certainly write a testcase for the method returning
inputstream and checking what is returned in the
stream. What do you think??

Regards,
Manpreet

P.S. Thanx Lothar, for jotting down all in points
regarding what all should be tested.
